components: VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL,ELECTRONIC STABILITY CONTROL,SERVICE BRAKES
summary: PLEASE INVESTIGATE! APPROX. 3 DAYS AGO I WAS COMING TO A STOP SIGN IN A RESIDENTIAL AREA & APPLIED BRAKES. SPEED LIMIT IS 25, BUT I WAS GOING SLOWER, JUST TO THE CORNER PAST MY HOME. NOT ONLY DID BRAKES NOT WORK- THE CAR BEGAN TO ACCELERATE ON ITS OWN TO ABOUT 35-40 MPH- NO GAS APPLIED. TRIED PUMPING BRAKES, SHIFTING THE CAR INTO NEUTRAL, REVERSE, PARK- ALL WHILE AT AN UNEXPECTED ACCELERATED SPEED. I PLOWED INTO A RESIDENTIAL YARD WHICH HAD A SMALL HILL THINKING MAYBE I COULD STOP THE CAR THAT WAY. THAT DIDN'T WORK. I SWERVED BACK INTO THE STREET; CAR STILL REVVING AND MOVING FORWARD. AT THAT POINT I THOUGHT I WAS GOING TO CRASH INTO A HOUSE, POLE OR ANOTHER VEHICLE. I ENDED UP HALFWAY ON THE STREET AND HALFWAY ON A CURB AFTER CONTINUOUSLY TRYING THE BRAKES AND SHIFTING FROM DRIVE TO PARK (VEHICLE STILL ACCELERATING AS IF IT WAS POSSESSED!!) AND JUST BEFORE HITTING A LIGHT POLE, WITH DRIVER SIDE DOOR OPEN THINKING I'D RATHER JUMP OUT OF A MOVING VEHICLE THAN DIE FROM RAMMING INTO A POLE, HOUSE OR CAR- I THOUGHT TO TURN PHYSICALLY TURN OFF THE IGNITION WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS IN DRIVE. THIS IS THE ONLY WAS THE CAR WOULD STOP MOVING. THIS WAS A VERY DISTURBING AND DANGEROUS EXPERIENCE. I HAVE NO DOUBT THIS IS NOT A NORMAL ISSUE AND SHOULD BE RECALLED AND FIXED BY THE MANUFACTURER- WHATEVER IT IS. MY MECHANIC STILL HAS NOT DETERMINED WHAT THE ISSUE IS. WE KNOW IT ISN'T AS SIMPLE AS JUST FIXING THE BRAKES. I AND/OR OTHER PEOPLE COULD HAVE BEEN KILLED IN THE PROCESS AND EVEN WORSE, MY TWO SMALL CHILDREN COULD HAVE BEEN IN THE CAR WHICH THANKFULLY THEY WERE NOT. THIS WAS SUCH A TRAUMATIC EXPERIENCE THAT I NO LONGER FEEL SAFE DRIVING THE CAR FOR FEAR IT COULD HAPPEN AGAIN WITH MY CHILDREN INSIDE. IF I HAVE THE CAR REPAIRED, I DON'T EVEN KNOW THAT I FEEL COMFORTABLE SELLING IT TO ANYONE ELSE- IT'S THAT DANGEROUS! PLEASE INVESTIGATE. THIS PROBLEM IS DEADLY. 2004 CADILLAC SRX 4DR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX.     SUNROOF PANEL DETACHED WHILE DRIVING  *DT    THE CONTACT WAS CONCERNED THE FAILURE WAS DUE TO A DESIGN FLAW.     THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT 70 MPH, THE SUNROOF PANEL DETACHED FROM THE VEHICLE AND FLEW OFF. ED MORSE CADILLAC DELRAY BEACH 2300 S FEDERAL HWY, DELRAY BEACH, FL 33483 (561) 900-3199 WAS CONTACT BY PHONE AND INFORMED OF THE FAILURE. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NO LONGER UNDER WARRANTY AND THAT THE REPAIR WOULD BE AN OUT OF POCKET EXPENSE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND INFORMED OF THE FAILURE AND A CASE WAS OPENED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 105,000.   CONSUMER STATED THE ADHESIVE LOST AND FAIL.*JB
MY 2007 CADILLAC SRX AIRBAG IS BULGING OUT AND KEEPS GETTING WORSE.
3OF MY BRAKE LINE BURST AT A STOP LIGHT WHEN STOPPING IN A SHOP NOW AREN'T THE LINE MADE OF HIGH GRADE METAL THAT SHOULD LAST LIFE OF THE CAR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE REAR DIFFERENTIAL LEAKED WITHOUT WARNING. IN ADDITION, THE CHECK ENGINE INDICATOR ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO  GERMAIN CADILLAC (4200 MORSE CROSSING, COLUMBUS, OH 43219, (614) 421-2007) WHERE THE MECHANIC PLACED STRUTS ON THE VEHICLE. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED ABOUT THE REAR DEFERENTIAL THAT MAY LEAK. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED FOR THE LEAK. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 150,000. THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE WAS A RECALL FOR THE HUB- BEARINGS. THE BRAKE PADS AND ROTORS WERE SEVERELY DAMAGED BY A RECURRING ISSUE THAT HAD HAPPENED SEVERAL TIMES SINCE THE ORIGINAL RECALL REPAIR. THERE WAS AN INITIAL TWO YEAR WARRANTY ON THE ORIGINAL RECALL REPAIR. THE DEALER WHERE THE ORIGINAL RECALL REPAIRS WHERE PERFORMED WAS SCHEPEL CADILLAC 2929 W LINCOLN HWY, MERRILLVILLE, IN 46410 (219) 472-1403. WHEN THE PROBLEM RECURRED IT WAS SIX MONTHS AFTER THE WARRANTY EXPIRED. THE CONTACT HAD TAKEN THE VEHICLE SINCE TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC. THE PROBLEM HAD RECURRED THREE TIMES WITHIN THE LAST FOUR YEARS WITH  IT POSSIBLY  LEADING TO A SERIOUS CRASH. THE VEHICLE WAS CURRENTLY AT AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WITH THE LATEST REPAIRS BEING UNCOMPLETED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 90,000.

WHILE DRIVING DOWN THE HIGHWAY AT APPROXIMATELY 70MPH ALL OF A SUDDEN THE DISPLAY IN THE VEHICLE SAID ENGINE POWER REDUCED, THE VEHICLE THEN LOST ALL POWER AND STOPPED ON A FOUR LANE HIGHWAY IN THE MIDDLE OF TRAFFIC, AND WILL NO LONGER START.     WE BELIEVE THE ISSUE HAS TO DO WITH THE TIMING CHAIN.   IN DOING SOME RESEARCH, WE FOUND CASE #10287 AND FOUND THAT   GM OFFERED AN EXTENDED WARRANTY FOR THE TIMING CHAIN, UNTIL FEB 2017.   WE PURCHASED THE VEHICLE FEBRUARY OF 2018.     WE CALLED GM AND SPOKE WITH REPRESENTATIVES THAT SAID THERE WAS IN FACT A RECALL FOR OUR EXACT MAKE, MODEL AND YEAR FOR THE PREMATURE WARE OF THE TIMING CHAIN, BUT IT WAS NOT WITH OUR VIN.

2 TIMING CHAINS WITHIN 8 MONTHS JUST PUT THE SECOND ONE IN ON SATURDAY AND 4 DAYS LATER THE CAR IS MAKING THE SAME NOISE AGAIN. I HAVE SPOKE TO MANY PEOPLE ABOUT THIS AND THEY ARE TELLING ME THIS IS A PROBLEM WITH THIS MOTOR.  THE SECOND TIME THE TIMING CHAIN WENT I WAS DRIVING DOWN ROUTE 55 IN NJ  AND THE CAR SHUT OFF AND WOULD NOT START THE FIRST TIME IT WENT I WAS IN THE DRIVEWAY AND WOULD NOT STAY RUNNING. I DO NOT HAVE THE MONEY TO KEEP PUTTING IN THIS OR THE FUNDS TO GET ANOTHER CAR I EXPECT WHEN I PIT MONEY INTO THE CAR I DON'T EXPECT IT TO START RUNNING THE WAY IT WAS WHEN THE TIMING CHAIN WENT.
2007 CADILLAC SRX.  CONSUMER WRITES IN REGARDS TO VEHICLE FRAME RAILS RUST ISSUES.  *SMD  *JS

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC AND WAS INFORMED THAT THE HEADLIGHTS WERE RETAINING WATER. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED, BUT THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN BACK TO THE INDEPENDENT MECHANIC, BUT WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED TO TAKE THE VEHICLE TO A CADILLAC DEALER. THE VEHICLE WAS THEN TAKEN TO SONIC AUTOMOTIVE CADILLAC OF SOUTH CHARLOTTE (10725 PINEVILLE RD, PINEVILLE, NC 28134, PHONE NUMBER (704) 900-2252) WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT WATER WAS GETTING INTO THE HEADLIGHTS AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE DEALER ALSO INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN A RECALL. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED DUE TO THE COST. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURES AND REFERRED THE CONTACT TO NHTSA. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 180,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. WHILE DRIVING 50 MPH, THE VEHICLE LOST POWER AND WOULD NOT ACCELERATE. IN ADDITION, THE POWER STEERING WAS DIFFICULT TO CONTROL AND THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKES WOULD LOCK WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A DEALER FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 99,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE HAD BEEN VARIOUS WARNING LIGHTS ILLUMINATING AND THERE WAS AN ABNORMAL NOISE HEARD COMING FROM THE AREA OF THE ENGINE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER SEVERAL TIMES WHERE THE FAILURE WAS UNABLE TO BE DETERMINED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE AND VIN WERE NOT AVAILABLE.
I'M HAVING TRANSMISSION ISSUES, I CALLED GM AND THEY VERIFIED NO RECALLS WERE ON THIS MODEL, I HAVE HAD 3 TRANSMISSIONS REPLACED AND NOW FOUND OUT THAT I HAVE TO HAVE ANOTHER TRANSMISSION.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. ON EACH SIDE OF THE VEHICLE, THERE WERE AIR DISTRIBUTION UNITS. EACH UNIT, OUTLINED IN A SILVER COMPONENT, PRODUCED A GLARE AND REFLECTION THAT AFFECTED VISIBILITY IN THE REARVIEW MIRROR. IN ADDITION, THE GLARE IMPACTED THE CONTACT'S VISION WHILE LOOKING THROUGH THE REARVIEW AND FRONT MIRRORS. THE DEALER AND MANUFACTURER WERE NOTIFIED, BUT DID NOT PROVIDE A REPAIR SOLUTION. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 54,600.

I DISCOVERED FLUID LEAKING UNDER THE VEHICLE AND A BANGING, LOUD NOISE WAS PRESENT WHEN SHIFTING TO 1ST GEAR. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE MECHANIC WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE REAR DIFFERENTIAL GASKET WAS RUPTURED. I CALLED THE GMC DEALER IN COSTA MESA, CA AND I WAS INFORMED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 07V589000 (POWER TRAIN), EVEN IF THE VEHICLE EXPERIENCED THE SAME FAILURE LISTED IN THE RECALL. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 65-70,000M. PLEASE HELP ME SINCE THE DEALER SAID IS NOT THEIR RESPONSABILITY, BECAUSE BASED ON THE VIN NUMBER, THIS CAR IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE RECALL. THE RECALL STARTED ON DEC.20, 2007, SO I'M ALMOST 100% THAT MY VEHICLE WAS BUILT BEFORE THAT DAY IN THE YEAR OF 2007. PLEASE HELP ME SINCE THIS NOISE IS SO LOUD AND THE BANGING IS SO POWERFULL, THAT MY KIDS ALWAYS THINK THAT I HIT OR SOMEBODYELSE HIT OUR CAR.
INSTRUMENT PANEL LIGHTS DO NOT COME ON AFTER LEAVING A DARK AREA WHILE DRIVING.

TAKATA RECALL- I HAVE A, SERVICE AIRBAG, WARNING THAT HAS COME ON FOR THE SECOND TIME. I HAVE NEVER HEARD OF A CAR DOING THIS. IS THIS NORMAL? THE FIRST TIME IT CAME ON AND WENT OFF THE SAME DAY, NOW IT HAS  BEEN ON A WEEK.

I HAVE TAKEN MY VEHICLE TO THIS SHOP TWICE NOW FOR MY TIMING. THEY CLAIM THEY HAVE REPAIRED IT TWICE & ALSO REPLACED A VARIABLE VALVE TIMING SOLENOID. ALMOST 3,000.00. ONCE AGAIN IT QUIT WORKING MONTHS AGO. HAD IT TOWED TO ANOTHER MECHANIC & WHEN DIAGNOSED, IT WENT BACK TO THE TIMING CHAINS FOR THE 3RD TIME IN LESS THAN A YEAR. MY MECHANIC WENT ON LINE & INFORMED ME CADILLAC HAS HAS A LOT OF PROBLEMS WITH THE TIMING ON THEIR CARS. PLS HELP. I AM DISABLED & I THINK THERE SHOULD BE A RECALL ON THIS CAR. WHEN I WAS DRIVING IT THIS LAST TIME, THE CAR WOULD SPEED UP ON ITS OWN WHICH WAS VERY SCARY FOR ME. WHEN I GOT TO MY DESTINATION A MILE UP THE ROAD IT DIED. I TRIED TO START IT & IT WOULD START BUT WOULDN'T TURN OVER. WHEN I LET GO OF THE KEY IT STAYED ON & KEPT TRYING TO START ON ITS OWN, LIKE I HAD THE KEY TURNED. IT DID SHUT OFF FINALLY WHEN I TURNED IT OFF. AFTER THE MECHANIC AT CABLES FIXED THE TIMING THE FIRST TIME, I WAS INFORMED IF I DIDN'T REPLACE THE VARIABLE VALVE TIMING SOLENOID, HE COULD NOT GUARANTEE THE TIMING AGAIN SO I PAID TO HAVE THAT DONE AS WELL. THIS ALL STARTED 7-24-14 & HAS BEEN IN THE SHOP OFF & ON SINCE THEN. I RECENTLY LOST MY YOUNGEST DAUGHTER & AM DISABLED SO MY TRANSPORTATION IS EVERYTHING TO ME & I CAN'T KEEP PAYING FOR THIS TIMING SINCE I AM NOW PAYING FOR FUNERAL EXPENSES ALONG WITH MANY OTHER RELATED EXPENSES. PLS PLS HELP.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 60 MPH, THERE WAS AN ABNORMAL NOISE COMING FROM THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 07V589000 (POWER TRAIN) THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 60,000.

CAR STARTED RATTLEING WHEN FIRST STARTING. SHORTLY AFTER MY CHECK ENGINE LIGHT CAME ON AND IT WAS RUNNING ROUGH ALL THE TIME THEN. BROUGHT IT TO A MECHANIC AND FOUND OUT IT'S THE TIMING CHAIN. SUPER EXPENSIVE TO REPLACE AND PER. FORUMS LOOKS LIKE TONS OF PEOPLE WITH THE 2006 SRX HAD THIS PROBLEM AS WELL. NOTHING BUT CONSTANT REPAIR BILLS WITH THIS CROSSOVER. I FEEL IT IS A SAFETY ISSUE AS IT COULD BREAK AT ANY TIME FROM BEING LOOSE. I FEEL THIS SHOULD BE RECALLED AND REPLACED.

FRAME RUSTED THROUGH ON BOTH LEFT AND RIGHT SIDES.  SERVICE MANAGER MADE COMMENT THAT FRAME RUSTED THROUGH FROM THE INSIDE OF FRAME RAIL.  CADILLAC WILL NOT TAKE ANY RESPONSIBILITY FOR REPAIRS.  ALSO INCLUDES RUSTING OF FUEL LINES NEXT TO FRAME.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE SUN ROOF WAS LEAKING WATER ON THE REAR DRIVER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 67,604. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT DISCOVERED FLUID LEAKING UNDER THE VEHICLE AND A BANGING NOISE WAS PRESENT WHEN DRIVING. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE DIFFERENTIAL BOLTS WERE WORN AND A GASKET HAD RUPTURED. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 07V589000 (POWER TRAIN). THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE EXPERIENCED THE SAME FAILURE LISTED IN THE RECALL. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 112,200. UPDATED 09/15/15*LJ   UPDATED 11/03/2017*CN

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 35 MPH, THE CHECK ENGINE WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED AND THE STEERING WHEEL STARTED TO SHAKE. THE CONTACT MENTIONED THAT THERE WAS A CLICKING SOUND EMITTING FROM THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING. THE TECHNICIAN STATED THAT THERE WAS A LEAK IN THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE AND THE FUEL INJECTOR AND MASS AIR SENSOR NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 110,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT FLAMES WERE EMITTING FROM THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE DEALER, BUT WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THERE WERE NO INJURIES. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 130,000.

WHILE DRIVING ON INTERSTATE, CRUISE CONTROL SET TO 68 MPH., APPROXIMATELY 6:25 P.M., TEMPERATURE IN MID 60S, ALL WINDOWS ROLLED UP, ENVIRONMENTAL SET TO 70, THE ULTRAVIEW SUNROOF OF OUR 2007 CADILLAC SRX IMPLODED INTO THE PASSENGER COMPARTMENT.  THERE WERE NO VEHICLES IN FRONT OF US, SO NO DEBRIS TOSSED UP, WIFE AND SON RECEIVED SMALL CUTS TO FACE AND ARMS, NO MEDICAL ATTENTION REQUIRED.  NO FOREIGN OBJECTS FOUND WHEN CLEANING CAR TO TAKE TO DEALERSHIP.  NO INDICATIONS/SOUNDS SUNROOF WAS DAMAGED AND ABOUT TO GIVE WAY.  CAR HAD JUST COME FROM DEALERSHIP FOR  60000 MILE MILESTONE SERVICE AND REPAIR OF SMALL ITEMS.   *JS

TRANSFER CASE FAILED AT 54,000 MILES ON A 7-YEAR OLD CAR.  LOCAL MECHANIC REPAIRED FOR $2700 AND NOTED THAT IT'S A COMMON PROBLEM FOR THIS MODEL.    THE CAR JERKED BACK AND FORTH DURING DRIVING AT ALL SPEEDS.   *TR

MY IGNITION SWITCH AND NON STARTING ISSUES ARE DOCUMENTED WITH MY 2007 CADILLAC SRX...MANY OF THE ISSUES LISTED IN THE RECALL FOR SRX VEHICLES NOT IN MY YEAR.  THERE IS A DOCUMENTED HISTORY OF MY VEHICLES HAVING STARTING ISSUES RELATED TO THE BATTERY BEING DRAINED....AND I BELIEVE THE ISSUE WITH THE IGNITION SWITCH MAY HAVE BEEN THE PROBLEM ALL ALONG.  MY YEAR VEHICLE/VIN IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE CURRENT RECALL, HOWEVER, I TRULY AM HAVING THE SAME ISSUES WITH THE IGNITION SWITCH...IT MOVES AROUND....IT WIGGLES....SOMETIMES CAR WON'T START...MIMICS ELECTRICAL PROBLEMS BACK DASH LIGHT INDICATORS.  THERE IS AN ISSUE HERE.   *TR

2007 CADILLAC SRX BRAKES WERE APPLIED AT 60 MPH; BRAKE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR AND BRAKING ACTION WAS NON-EXISTENT. SECOND PUSH ON THE BRAKE PEDAL PROVIDED SOME BRAKING ACTION AND THE VEHICLE SUCCESSFULLY CAME TO A STOP ON THE SHOULDER. NO DASH WARNING LIGHTS OR SIGNALS WERE OBSERVED. VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A GM DEALER; THEIR INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE RIGHT SIDE FRONT BRAKE PIPE(TUBING) BURST DUE TO CORROSION. MASTER BRAKE CYLINDER WAS EMPTY.  *TR

TURN SIGNAL - HIGH BEAMS COMPONENTS. HIGH BEAMS ACTIVATES AT ANYTIME WHILE DRIVING AND WHEN THE TURN SIGNALS ARE USED( LEFT OR RIGHT ). WAS PULLED OVER IN A SPEED TRAP, GIVING A WARNING FOR IMPEDING POLICE DUTIES. I PURCHASED A TURN SIGNAL REPLACEMENT, CAN'T FIND ANYONE TO INSTALL IT.  *TR

THE PROBLEM INVOLVES THE VEHICLE'S TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM.  THE CAR INTERMITTENTLY AFTER COMING TO A COMPLETE STOP AND TURNING INTO ONCOMING TRAFFIC WILL LOSE ALL ACCELERATION POWER FOR TWO TO THREE SECONDS.  DURING THESE TWO TO THREE SECONDS, THEIR IS A HOPELESS FEELING AS YOU QUICKLY LOOK INTO YOUR REAR VIEW MIRROR AND PRAY THAT THE CAR BEHIND IS SLOWING DOWN OR SWERVING INTO THE LEFT LANE TO AVOID A COLLISION.  THIS HAPPENS ON DRY AND CLEAN PAVEMENT WITHOUT ANY LEGITIMATE REASON.  AFTER ROLLING SLOWLY WITHOUT POWER THE ACCELERATOR WILL SUDDENLY ENGAGE.  *TR

I WAS DRIVING ON THE HIGHWAY AT 55 MPH, WHEN A LOUD POP NOISE FROM THE REAR HAPPENED. MY VEHICLE SPINNED OUT OF CONTROL SEVERAL TIMES IN A CIRCLE BEFORE HITTING A MEDIAN BARRIER.    I HAD THE PROBLEM FIXED IN MARCH 2014...     THE SAME PROBLEM HAPPENED AGAIN ON 4/7/2014, EXCEPT I DIDN'T HIT A MEDIAN.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 40 MPH, THE OVERHEAD AIR BAGS DEPLOYED WITHOUT WARNING. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR DIAGNOSIS. THE DEALER STATED THEY DID NOT KNOW WHY THE AIR BAG DEPLOYED. THE MANUFACTURE WAS CONTACTED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 151,000. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

HELLO, THE REASON FOR MY EMAIL IS THAT JUST THIS PAST MONDAY, NOVEMBER 25 OF 2013 THE SUNROOF TO MY 2007 CADILLAC SRX EXPLODED WHILE DRIVING ON THE FREEWAY WITH NO EXPLANATION. THIS HAPPENED AROUND 8PM ON A COLD AND DRIZZLY NIGHT. BIG CHUNKS OF GLASS FELL ALL OVER MY HUSBAND AND I LEAVING US WITH MINOR SCRATCHES, FORTUNATELY NO ONE WAS SEVERELY HURT. THE FOLLOWING MORNING OF THE INCIDENT I WENT ONLINE AND CAME ACROSS SEVERAL IDENTICAL INCIDENTS WITH THE SAME MAKE AND MODEL OF CAR, AS WELL AS OTHERS. WE TOOK THE LIBERTY OF CONTACTING GM CORPORATE HEADQUARTERS AS IT SEEMS THIS MAY POSSIBLY BE A FACTORY DEFECT. THE VEHICLE IS CURRENTLY AT THE DEALER SHIP BUT AS OF RIGHT NOW THERE HAS NOT BEEN MUCH HELP, MUCH LESS AN EXPLANATION. MY BIGGEST CONCERN IS THE SAFETY OF THE VEHICLE BEING THAT I AM 8 1/2 MONTHS PREGNANT AND THIS IS OUR ONLY VEHICLE. HOW SAFE WILL THIS BE FOR MY FAMILY? I DO NOT FEEL COMFORTABLE AND I AM NOT AT EASE THAT I HAVE NOT HEARD FROM THE LOCAL CADILLAC DEALERSHIP WHERE ALL I HAVE HEARD FROM THEM IS AN ISSUE OF HOW MANY MILES THE CAR HAS AT THE PRESENT TIME AND NOT THE FACT THAT THIS WAS A LIFE OR DEATH SITUATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS IS TO SEEK OUT ANY KIND OF HELP, INFORMATION, OR ADVICE AS TO WHAT WE CAN DO TO HAVE THIS SITUATION RESOLVED. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR TIME AND HOPE TO HEAR FROM YOU SOON.  *TR

I WAS DRIVING ON TX HIGHWAY146 ON 11/21/2012, THE MORNING BEFORE THANKSGIVING, THE SUN-ROOF SUDDENLY EXPLODED; IT WAS AS LOUD AS A GUN SHOT IF NOT LOUDER, THE SOUND STARTLED ME THAT I VEERED OUT OF MY LANE; LUCKILY, THERE WAS NO ONE ELSE ON THE ROAD. EVEN THOUGH I WAS SHOCKED, NO ONE WAS HURT. I DON'T THINK IT IS AN ISOLATED INCIDENT BUT CADILLAC IS NOT GOING TO DO ANYTHING ABOUT THIS UNSAFE SUNROOF.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT WAS DRIVING 45 MPH WHEN THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKING SYSTEM ENGAGED, CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO DECELERATE. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO A DEALER FOR A DIAGNOSTIC TEST WHICH DETERMINED A DEFECTIVE PCM. THE DEALER REPROGRAMMED THE PCM, REPLACED THE REAR BRAKES, ROTORS AND A STEERING COLUMN SENSOR HOWEVER, NONE OF THE REPAIRS REMEDIED THE BRAKE PROBLEM. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 78,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE DRIVER SIDE SEAT WOULD NOT ELEVATE HIGH ENOUGH IN ORDER FOR HER TO SEE OVER THE STEERING WHEEL. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHO ADVISED THAT THEY WERE UNABLE TO MODIFY THE SEAT DUE TO THE AIR BAG BEING ALIGNED WITH THE SEAT. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND THEY OFFERED NO ASSISTANCE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 50,502. CONTACT HAS TO USE PILLOW TO GET HIGHT ENOUGH TO SEE. BOTH DEALER AND MANUFACTURER WERE IN FORMED OF THIS. NEITHER SEEM TO NOT CARE AND AIR BAGS WERE NOT MENTIONED AS AN ISSUE. UPDATED 11/02/2011 *LN  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX.  THE CONTACT STATED THE TIRE PRESSURE MONITORING SYSTEM WARNING LIGHT WAS ILLUMINATED, INDICATING THAT THE TIRES WERE AT LOW PRESSURE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE PRESSURE LEVEL WAS AT THE CORRECT SPECIFICATIONS BUT THE WARNING LIGHT WAS STILL ILLUMINATED ERRONEOUSLY. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER AND WHERE REPAIRS WERE MADE HOWEVER, THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE HAD BEEN TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOUR TIMES BUT NONE OF THE REPAIRS REMEDIED THE ISSUE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 70,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 5 MPH, THE DRIVER AND PASSENGER SIDE WINDOW AIR BAGS DEPLOYED WITHOUT WARNING. THE VEHICLE WAS THEN TOWED TO THE DEALER WHERE THEY ADVISED THAT AN INVESTIGATOR WOULD HAVE TO FURTHER INSPECT THE FAILURE. ONCE DIAGNOSED, THE DEALER ADVISED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS ACTING IN A CORRECT MANNER AS IF THE VEHICLE WERE GOING TO ROLLOVER. THE CONTACT WAS NOT INVOLVED IN ANY TYPE OF CRASH AT THE TIME OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE UNKNOWN.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE CHROME ON THE INSIDE AIR VENTS REFLECTED OFF THE OUTSIDE REARVIEW MIRROR, IMPAIRING THE CONTACTS VISION. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER WHO STATED THAT THERE WERE NO RELATED RECALLS. THE CONTACT CALLED THE MANUFACTURER WHO CONFIRMED THAT THERE WERE NO RECALLS AND PROVIDED NO FURTHER ASSISTANCE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 52,000 AND THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 50,500.

2007 SRX CAMSHAFT DRIVE CHAINS WEARING OUT[STRETCHING]PREMATURELY WITH LESS THAN 20,000 MILES ON THE VEHICLE.CONDITION COULD CAUSE FAILURE OF THE CHAINS LEADING TO LOSS OF MOTIVE POWER. CADILLAC IS AWARE OF THE PROBLEM BUT HAS DECLINED TO NOTIFY OWNERS OF THE AFFECTED VEHICLES. ENGINE IS THE 3.6 LITER V-6. SERVICE WRITER AT THE DEALERSHIP STATED TO ME THAT CADILLAC HAD RECEIVED A BATCH OF THE AFFECTED CHAINS FROM THEIR SUPPLIER,APPARENTLY THERE IS A TSB[TECHNICAL SERVICE BULLETIN]OUT IN REGARDS TO THIS PROBLEM. ALSO ,STATED THAT THEY HAD REPAIRED ABOUT TEN OF THIS MODEL TO DATE. *TR

MY HUSBAND PURCHASED MY VEHICLE IN OCTOBER, 2006. WITHIN 2 MONTHS IT WAS RETURNED TO THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT OF THE DEALER. THE CHROME HANDLE HAD STARTED PEELING ON THE DRIVER SIDE, THE REAR WINDOW SEAL WAS LEAKING WHENEVER IT WOULD RAIN AND THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT WAS ON. THE LEAK WAS REPAIRED, I WAS TOLD THAT THE ENGINE LIGHT WAS ON BECAUSE WE TOOK THE FACTORY WHEELS OFF AND THEY WOULD CALL US WHEN THE HANDLE CAME IN. THAT NEVER HAPPENED. TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF 2008 THE FOLLOWING MESSAGES STARTED SHOWING UP. TRACTION CONTROL ON AND POWER TO ENGINE REDUCED  CAUSING MY VEHICLE TO STOP IN TRAFFIC SUDDENLY THIS CAUSED CARS TO SWERVE AROUND ME TO PREVENT IMPACT. THE DAY IN QUESTION I HAD JUST PICKED MY [XXX] OLD DAUGHTER UP FROM HER AUDITION. WE WERE MERGING ONTO I-75 WHEN I HEARD A LOUD SOUND COME FROM THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE. MY VEHICLE IMMEDIATELY SPUN OUT OF CONTROL HEADING FOR THE ONCOMING CARS, BIG RIGS AND TRUCKS. I MISSED THE CEMENT WALL BY THE GRACE OF GOD AND LANDED IN A SNOW EMBANKMENT. THE TIMING CHAINS  AND REAR AXLE SHAFT WERE REPLACED AND THAT DID NOT HELP. WITHIN 24 HOURS THE VEHICLE WAS DOING THE SAME THING SHUTTING POWER DOWN TO THE ENGINE AND I HAD TO RETURN IT TO THE DEALER. THEY FINALLY REPLACED THE DOOR HANDLE AFTER FINDING OUT THAT IT HAD CUT MY FINGER CAUSING ME TO RECEIVE 3 STITCHES. I NO LONGER FEEL SAFE DRIVING THIS VEHICLE AND WOULD LIKE FOR GM TO STEP UP AND TAKE IT BACK WITHOUT PENALTY. IF I WANTED THE HEADACHE OF BEING IN AND OUT OF SOMEONE'S SERVICE CENTER I WOULD HAVE PURCHASED A USED VEHICLE OR WHAT THEY CALL A HOOPTY. *TR    PARTS OF THIS DOCUMENT HAVE BEEN REDACTED TO PROTECT PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE INFORMATION PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).

WE BOUGHT THE VEHICLE FROM A USED DEALER WITH FACTORY WARRANTY REMAINING. I NOTICED GEAR OIL LEAKING FROM THE REAR DIFFERENTIAL AXLE. I TOOK THE VEHICLE INTO HERITAGE @ 30,000 MILES. THEY REPLACED A VENT HOSE BULLETIN 07-04-20-0019. I PICKED THE VEHICLE UP AND FOUND THE LEAK EVEN WORSE THE NEXT MORNING. I IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE VEHICLE BACK ON 1/22/08 AND HAS BEEN IN THE SHOP TO DATE 2/18/09. WHEN RETURNED VEHICLE THE DEALER HAD TO CONTACT GM TO FIND OUT WHAT TO DO NEXT. THEY REPLACE THE ENTIRE REAR DIFFERENTIAL AXLE.I WAS CALLED TO PICK UP OUR TRUCK ONLY TO DISCOVER NOW THE ENGINE CHECK LIGHT WILL NOT GO OFF. AGAIN THEY HAVE TO CALL GM TO SEE WHAT TO DO NEXT. I'M TOLD THEY WILL NOW BE REPLACING THE ENTIRE CAM-SHAFT SENSORS AND TIMING CHAINS. *TR

CADILLAC SRX MY 2007.   SPONTANEOUS SHATTERING OF ULTRA VIEW SUN/MOON ROOF.  NO OBJECT HAS EVER STRUCK ROOF TOP.  DRIVING 45 MPH ON OPEN ROAD, SOUTH BOUND ON GRATIOT AVE. IN CHESTERFIELD, MI.  RELATIVELY SMOOTH ROAD SURFACE.  AMBIENT TEMPERATURE 36 DEGREES F, LIGHT RAIN.  INTERIOR TEMPERATURE 70 DEGREES F.  VEHICLE MILEAGE: 7800  FLYING SHARDS OF GLASS FORCED MY SONS TO STOP AND REMOVE LOOSE SHARDS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO FOLLOWING VEHICLES.  NO INJURIES DUE TO SUN VISOR BEING CLOSED. *TR

WITHOUT ANY NOTICE OR LIGHTS OR ANYTHING, MY 2007 CADILLAC SRX WILL LOOSE POWER AND DECELERATE FROM 60 TO 0 IN JUST A FEW SECONDS.  I CAN HAVE THE GAS PEDAL TO THE FLOOR AND THE CAR DOES NOT MOVE, EVEN THOUGH THE MOTOR IS STILL RUNNING.  IT IS AS IF THE CAR IS IN NEUTRAL.  ONCE YOU TURN THE CAR OFF AND ON AGAIN, IT WILL RUN FINE FOR A FEW DAYS OR A WEEK OR SO BEFORE HAPPENING AGAIN.  THIS HAS HAPPENED 4 OR 5 TIMES AND THE DEALER SAYS WITHOUT BEING ABLE TO REPRODUCE THE PROBLEM THERE IS NOTHING THEY CAN DO.  ONE TIME I WAS ON A MAJOR HIGHWAY AND COULD NOT GET OUT OF THE ROAD.  OTHER VEHICLES WERE SWERVING AROUND ME AT 60+ MILES PER HOUR.  I COULD HAVE BEEN SERIOUSLY INJURED ANY ONE OF THE TIMES THIS HAS HAPPENED TO MY VEHICLE.  THIS STARTED AT ONLY 25,000 MILES.  I ALSO HAVE A GRINDING NOISE IN THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE AS WELL AS WHEN THE FRONT WHEELS ARE TURNED.  THIS HAS BEEN GOING ON ALMOST EVER SINCE I GOT THE VEHICLE 14 MONTHS AGO.  IT HAS BEEN TAKEN TO THE DEALER TIME AND TIME AGAIN AND IS STILL NOT FIXED.  I EVEN CALLED GM/CADILLAC AND STILL GOT NO SATISFACTION.  I AM AFRAID THE WHEELS ARE GOING TO FALL OFF AT ANYTIME.  I AM ALSO  AFRAID I AM GOING TO BE HURT WHEN THESE PROBLEMS HAPPEN ON THE HIGHWAY, IT IS A COMPANY VEHICLE AND I HAVE TO CARRY FELLOW EMPLOYEES WITH ME ON NUMEROUS OCCASIONS.  I NO LONGER CARRY ANYONE WITH ME BECAUSE OF THE POTENTIAL DANGER.  NO ONE CAN TELL ME WHAT IS WRONG OR HOW TO FIX IT AND CADILLAC HAS BEEN ABSOLUTELY UNCOOPERATIVE WITH ME. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX.  WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 25 MPH, THE VEHICLE DECELERATED WITHOUT THE BRAKE PEDAL BEING DEPRESSED.  THE VEHICLE AUTOMATICALLY BEGAN TO JERK AS IF THE CONTACT HAD ABRUPTLY DOWNSHIFTED INTO ANOTHER GEAR.  HE HEARD A LOUD GRINDING NOISE IN THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE.  THERE WERE NO WARNING INDICATORS PRIOR TO THIS FAILURE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC AND THEY STATED THAT THE REAR AXLE PINION SEAL WAS LEAKING.  THE REAR AXLE LOST THE ENTIRE CONSUMPTION OF OIL AND SUSTAINED MAJOR DAMAGE.  THE PINION SEALS WERE PREVIOUSLY PLACED UNDER RECALL, BUT THEY HAVE SINCE FAILED.  THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED.  THE RECALL NUMBER WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 57,900.    UPDATED 07/29/08  *BF  RECALL # 07V589000. UPDATED 08/01/08

PULLING OUT OF PARKING SPOT AND FRONT END DID NOT RESPOND TO TURNING OF WHEEL.  TIE ROD HAD FALLEN OUT OF THE HYDRAULIC CYLINDER.  CAR HAS 10,001 MILES.  IF THIS HAD OCCURRED WHILE DRIVING THERE IS A HIGH PROBABILITY OF A CRASH.  *TR

2007 CADILLAC SRX LOCKED DOWN WHILE DRIVING. CONSUMER STATED THAT HE LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE DUE TO THIS FAILURE AND HIT ANOTHER VEHICLE. CONSUMER STATED THAT THE INSURANCE COMPANY DEEMED THE VEHICLE A TOTAL LOSS.  *KB  THE CONSUMER RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE IN THE MAIL. RECALL# 07V589000.*JB

VEHICLE:  2007 CADILLAC SRX BUILD DATE APPROXIMATELY APRIL 2007  PROBLEM:  WHEEL LUG NUTS NOT STAYING TIGHT.    HISTORY:  ALL 24 LUG NUTS FOUND LOOSE OR FINGER TIGHT (ABLE TO BE REMOVED BY HAND WITH SOCKET BUT WITHOUT USING WRENCH) AT 3,500 MILES.  TIGHTENED BY OWNER USING OWNER'S CALIBRATED/CERTIFIED TORQUE WRENCH AND RETURNED VEHICLE TO DEALER FOR INSPECTION.  DEALER FOUND ALL LUG NUTS TIGHT.  DEALER RETURNED CAR TO OWNER.   NUTS RE-CHECKED AND FOUND  LOOSE ON 3 WHEELS.  RETURNED TO DEALER TO INSPECT AND TIGHTEN.  DEALER FOUND ALL LUG NUTS TIGHT BUT BROKE ONE (1) WHEEL STUD OFF TIGHTENING LOOSE STUD BEFORE REACHING SPECIFIED TORQUE.  DEALER RE-CHECKED THE PREVIOUSLY VERIFIED NUTS AND FOUND 3 NUTS ON ONE WHEEL AT LESS THAN THE PROPER TORQUE.   NO SIGN OF WHEEL DAMAGE FOUND.  ALL NUTS AND STUDS THREADED SMOOTHLY AND DID NOT APPEAR DAMAGED.  NO EVIDENCE  PAINT ACTED AS A SHIM THUS PREVENTING STUDS FROM ACHIEVING NECESSARY CLAMPING FORCE.  CONCLUSION: DETERMINED PROBLEM IS NOT THAT THE WHEEL NUTS WERE LOOSE, BUT THAT THEY WOULDN'T STAY TIGHT.   POSSIBLE CAUSE(S):  DEFECTIVE STUDS WITH IMPROPER STEEL HARDENING OR MATERIAL.  HYDROGEN EMBRITTLEMENT OF THE HARDENED ELECTROPLATED STUDS.  OVERTIGHTENED STUDS WHICH STRETCHED BEYOND ELASTIC LIMIT.  REASON OR TIME OF POSSIBLE OVER-TIGHTENING UNKNOWN; DEALERS RECORDS DO NOT SHOW WHEELS HAVE BEEN OFF THE VEHICLE.  DRIVING THE VEHICLE WITH LOOSE NUTS FROM TIME OF ASSEMBLY (NOT LIKELY IN MODERN ASSEMBLY LINE METHODS) OR LOOSENED NUTS (CAUSE UNKNOWN) WHICH SEQUENTIALLY STRETCHED EACH UNTIL FATIGUED.  NO EVIDENCE THIS COULD HAVE OCCURRED WITHOUT DEFORMING HOLES IN WHEEL.  REMEDY:  DEALER REMOVED AND INSPECTED WHEEL AND AXLE FLANGE AND REPLACED ALL WHEEL STUDS AND NUTS.  RESULT: NEW STUDS ARE PERFORMING SATISFACTORY AND HOLDING PROPER TORQUE.  NOT KNOWN IF OLD PARTS WERE KEPT.  *TR

I RECENTLY HAD A PROBLEM WITH MY CADILLAC SRX BECAUSE THE LEFT WHEEL ASSEMBLY FAILED AND MY TIRE  LITERALLY FELL OFF THE AXLE WHILE I WAS DRIVING.  I THOUGHT I WOULD BRING THIS POTENTIALLY SERIOUS PROBLEM TO YOUR ATTENTION BECAUSE IT APPEARS TO BE A COMBINATION OF DESIGN FLAW AND/OR DEALERSHIP REPAIR ISSUE. EITHER WAY THIS PROBLEM POTENTIALLY MAY IMPACT OTHER PEOPLE.  I ORIGINALLY HAD MY CAR SERVICED AT TUSTIN CADILLAC IN CALIFORNIA IN JUNE 2007 FOR A ?TRACTION ENGAGED? LIGHT PROBLEM. THE TRACTION LIGHT WAS ALWAYS COMING ON WHEN I ACCELERATED  MY CAR FROM THE STOP POSITION. THIS PROBLEM WAS FIXED AT THIS TIME AND I HAD NO PROBLEM UNTIL AROUND JULY 19, 2007.      ON THE SAME CAR SIDE AND TIRE THE MONTH EARLIER I EXPERIENCED PROBLEMS,  THERE A SERIOUS PROBLEM BECAUSE AS I WAS TOLD, A NUT HAD COME OFF THE REAR WHEEL AXLE ASSEMBLY.   I WAS ORIGINALLY TOLD AND ASSURED BY THE SERVICE ADVISOR THAT THE TWO EVENTS OF JUNE AND JULY  WERE NOT RELATED TO EACH OTHER. LATER THE SERVICE MANAGER EXPRESSED AND TOLD ME  THE TWO WERE MOST LIKELY ASSOCIATED. THE SERVICE MANAGER TREATED ME VERY WELL AND I APPRECIATED HIS HONESTY AND CONCERN FOR MY WELFARE. *JB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC SRX.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE ADVANCED AIR BAG LIGHTS ILLUMINATED INTERMITTENTLY WHEN HER CHILDREN WERE SEATED IN THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS OPERATING NORMALLY AND WAS UNABLE TO DUPLICATE THE FAILURE.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE IS 4,500 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 100.
